title: My Chemical Romance's Mikey: Lockdown is 'just a pause button'
description: My Chemical Romance had a comeback scheduled for 2020, but bassist Mikey says fans shouldn't panic.

description: Members of the Association of Photographers have been recording their lockdown experiences.

description: The UK’s Jewish population has been hit particularly hard by coronavirus, religious and community leaders say.

title: Coronavirus: Mixed reality headsets help medics treat Covid-19 patients
description: Hand gestures allow doctors to view x-rays and scans, and connect with colleagues in another room.

description: But for the second week in a row number of new fatalities falls in sign peak has passed.

description: The attack was "sophisticated" the airline said, adding that some credit card details had been accessed.

description: Law student Aya Hachem was not the intended target of the attack, police say.

description: The president claims hydroxychloroquine is harmless but regulators warn it may cause heart problems.

title: Glastonbury Festival fan paints iconic scenes on body
description: Lisa Davies finds an iconic view of the festival, reverses the image and then paints it on her body.

description: Watford captain Troy Deeney says he will not return to training with the club because he fears for his family's health amid the coronavirus pandemic.

description: The US president accuses the UN agency of having an "alarming lack of independence" from China.

title: No British Grand Prix without quarantine exemptions
description: Formula 1 says it will be unable to hold a British Grand Prix if personnel are not given exemptions from plans to quarantine international travellers.

title: Coronavirus: Young people 'most likely to lose work' in lockdown
description: One in three young workers is earning less than before the coronavirus outbreak, a report suggests.

description: Li Jingzhi quit her job to search China for her son, Mao Yin, who went missing in 1988.

description: Stores 'will have to discount heavily' to shift excess stock that may now be out of season, one analyst said.
